ratings.comment: Class was easy, Prof Mou was very organized about uploading lecture notes. He graded the class on curve. His lectures were clear.

I took Prof. Mou for Math 213. He was not as bad as I was expecting, but still not very good. His lectures were boring and he took forever to explain simple concepts. Not accessible outside of class for the most part, never responded to piazza forums and routinely did not explain due dates. Graded on 3 tests (Midterms 25% each, Final 35%) & HW 15%

Not bad if ur into math. even though he isn't the best teacher he still has useful resources like ask engaging questions in class and make study guides which r helpful for the tests. first 2 tests were easy but final was very difficult, but nothing we haven't seen before. curved the final grade very graciously. reread the lesson from the textbook.
Hard to understand and was not accessible outside of lectures. Lots of mistakes throughout lectures, homework, and exams.

The course I took with Prof Mou was Math 213, not 320. Was unclear about what material would be on lectures and exams. There were instances where the lecture notes were posted after the homework assignments were due. Slow to respond to emails, multiple errors in lecture that wouldn't be found until discussion. Final exam review key had many errors.

I'd give him a 0 if I could. Lectures are pointless because he takes forever explaining things, which also means that the class is chronically behind every other class in this course. Rarely offers explanations for anything, very quiet, exams are harder than anything you will see. This is a GPA buster if you are not careful.

Probably one of the worst professors I've had. He doesn't really answer questions and his lectures are read from the textbook. I always went to discussion because that was the only place I learned. Our class was always far behind from the other classes but the exams were still harder.

Not much in ways of positive feedback towards Prof Mou. He is not accessible outside class or over email/piazza. He claims exams are simlar to practice tests but that is a 50/50 chance. You could be screwed if you don't study more than what is on the practice exams. His lectures are bad, the helpfulness of the TAs is probably the only positive.

Terrible at teaching, only got a decent grade because practice exam was similar to real one so it was easy to study for. Stopped going to lectures after the first midterm because I didn't learn much in lecture

Be warned, his lectures will put you to sleep. He grades on very few things, making the overall grade rely on your midterm performance. This being said, the midterms often don't relate to what is taught and new material is introduced the day before the tests with no warning. Avoid if you can, he makes many mistakes and ignores students corrections

I would rate him a 0 if I could. He doesn't speak up well, ignores students, doesn't correct typos, the majoirty of lecture is useless information, and he just sucks in general. And his homework bears no similarity to what he tries to teach in lecture. Furthermore, his midterm exams,don't resemble any material learned in class.

Avoid him if you can. When asked what would be on the exam the week before, he says he's not seen the exam so he doesn't know. Doesn't understand what we're asking if we ask questions, and is generally inaccessible. The prof and TA(s) don't check Piazza so if you need help you're better off asking a classmate or googling it.
Terrible lectures. Little to no feedback. Homework is graded for correctness which is very difficult.

This semester was his first time teaching. It started incredibly bad but slowly got better over the semester. He takes forever to respond to emails. Grading also takes forever and there's no clear rubric. This class was pretty depressing but hopefully, he gets better in the future.

By far the worst professor I've ever had - vague on grading criteria, typically skims through examples (often suggests to do the actual work of the problem after class), and has twice now waited until the day before a midterm to teach concepts covered on the exam. Abandon all hope, ye who enroll here.

Is a really bad teacher, trouble communicating sometimes, often teaches kids after class in mandarin. Very hard to follow content and teaches topics a day before the exam and expects students to master it. Avoid if you can.

One of the most poorly designed Math classes I've been through- dense syllabus, poor timetable, major concepts relevant to exams(accounts for 78% of grade) being taught a DAY before them. Spends an arbitrary amount of time on problems, explaining too little on hard concepts. Exams are tangentially related to material at best. DON'T TAKE.
